definitions: band of cloth or other material worn around the upper arm
examples: The security guards wore bright yellow armbands for identification
She designed a beautiful beaded armband for the ceremony

definitions: comfortable chair with supports for both arms on the sides
examples: He settled into his favorite armchair to read the newspaper
The leather armchair matched perfectly with the living room decor

definitions: formal agreement between opposing sides to stop fighting temporarily or permanently
examples: The armistice was signed on November 11, ending World War I
Both nations agreed to an armistice while peace negotiations continued

definitions: metal or strong material worn to protect the body in battle
protective metal covering on military vehicles or structures
examples: Medieval knights wore heavy armor in battle for protection
The museum displayed a complete suit of armor from the fifteenth century
The tank's armor could withstand most conventional weapons
They reinforced the vehicle with additional armor plating

definitions: building where weapons and military equipment are stored and maintained
facility used by military units for training and administration purposes
examples: The old armory was converted into a community center
Guards patrol the armory twenty-four hours a day
The National Guard meets at the armory every Tuesday night
The armory hosts military training exercises throughout the year

definitions: hollow area under the arm where it joins the body
examples: He applied deodorant to his armpits after showering
The doctor checked for swollen lymph nodes in her armpit

definitions: distinctive and usually pleasant smell of food, flowers, or other substances
examples: The aroma of fresh coffee filled the entire kitchen
She loved the aroma of roses in her garden

definitions: state of being awake, alert, or stimulated physically or mentally
state of sexual excitement or physical readiness for sexual activity
examples: The loud noise caused immediate arousal from deep sleep
Caffeine increases arousal and mental alertness in most people
Physical arousal can occur through various forms of stimulation
The study examined patterns of arousal in different situations

definitions: person who adapts musical compositions for different instruments or voices
person who organizes or plans events, activities, or arrangements
examples: The arranger created a beautiful orchestral version of the song
She worked as an arranger for several famous jazz musicians
The wedding arranger coordinated all aspects of the ceremony
As chief arranger, he organized the entire conference schedule

definitions: quality of being unpleasantly proud and behaving as if more important than others
examples: His arrogance made it difficult to work with him
The team's arrogance led to their unexpected defeat

definitions: pointed tip of an arrow made of stone, metal, or other hard material
examples: The archaeologist discovered several ancient arrowheads at the site
He collected Native American arrowheads as a hobby

definitions: collection of weapons and military equipment stored for use
collection of resources, skills, or tools available for a purpose
examples: The military arsenal contained thousands of rifles and ammunition
Inspectors verified the destruction of the chemical weapons arsenal
She had an impressive arsenal of cooking techniques
The company built an arsenal of patents to protect their innovations

definitions: highly poisonous metallic element used in pesticides and various industrial processes
examples: Arsenic was once commonly used in rat poison
The water supply was tested for dangerous levels of arsenic

definitions: criminal act of deliberately setting fire to property or buildings
examples: The detective suspected arson when accelerants were found
He was convicted of arson and sentenced to ten years

definitions: person who commits the crime of deliberately setting fires to property
examples: The arsonist was caught after setting multiple fires
Police searched for the arsonist who targeted abandoned buildings

definitions: blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to body tissues
major route or channel for traffic, supplies, or communication
examples: The surgeon repaired the damaged artery during the operation
A blocked artery can cause serious health problems
The highway is a major artery connecting the two cities
This street serves as the main artery for downtown traffic

definitions: plant with large flower head eaten as a vegetable when cooked
examples: She prepared stuffed artichokes for the dinner party
The restaurant served grilled artichoke hearts with lemon

definitions: clear and precise pronunciation of words or expression of ideas
place where two bones are connected in the body allowing movement
examples: Her articulation was so clear that everyone understood perfectly
The teacher praised his articulation during the speech
The doctor examined the articulation between the hip bones
Proper articulation of joints is essential for movement

definitions: object made by humans, especially one of historical or cultural interest
something observed that is not naturally present but occurs due to process
examples: The museum displayed artifacts from ancient civilizations
Each artifact was carefully catalogued and preserved
The strange reading was just an artifact of the measurement
Digital artifacts appeared in the compressed image file

definitions: clever or cunning devices or expedients used to trick or deceive others
examples: The magician's artifice fooled even the skeptical audience
She saw through his artifice and refused to be manipulated

definitions: large guns used in warfare on land, including cannons and missile launchers
examples: The artillery bombardment lasted for three hours
Modern artillery can strike targets many miles away

definitions: worker skilled in making things by hand using traditional methods
examples: The artisan crafted beautiful pottery using ancient techniques
Local artisans sell their handmade goods at the market

definitions: creative skill or ability in art, music, writing, or other creative endeavors
examples: The chef's artistry was evident in every beautifully plated dish
Her artistry with watercolors earned international recognition

definitions: paintings, drawings, sculptures, or other visual art created by an artist
examples: The gallery featured artwork from emerging local artists
She carefully packed her artwork for the exhibition

definitions: position of dominant power or influence over others in a situation
examples: The company gained ascendancy in the technology market
Their military ascendancy lasted for several decades

definitions: person or thing that is rising in power, influence, or importance
examples: The young politician was clearly in the ascendant
Technology companies are in the ascendant in today's economy

definitions: act of rising or moving upward through air or space
act of rising to an important position or higher level
examples: The balloon's ascension was slow but steady
We watched the rocket's ascension into the night sky
Her ascension to CEO surprised many industry observers
The prince's ascension to the throne was celebrated nationwide

definitions: act of climbing or moving upward, especially up a mountain or slope
examples: The ascent to the summit took six hours
They began their ascent at dawn to avoid afternoon storms

definitions: person who practices severe self-discipline and abstains from worldly pleasures
examples: The ascetic lived alone in the mountains with few possessions
Many ascetics believe material goods distract from spiritual growth

definitions: small dish or container for holding cigarette ash and extinguished cigarettes
examples: The restaurant removed all ashtrays when smoking was banned
He emptied the ashtray and cleaned it thoroughly

definitions: tree with rounded leaves that flutter in the slightest breeze
examples: The aspen trees turned brilliant gold in autumn
We hiked through a grove of quaking aspen trees

definitions: black sticky substance mixed with gravel used for paving roads and surfaces
examples: Fresh asphalt was laid on the highway last week
The hot asphalt steamed in the summer rain

definitions: person who has ambitions to achieve a position, award, or status
examples: Several aspirants competed for the scholarship
The political aspirant campaigned vigorously for months

definitions: strong desire or ambition to achieve something important in life
medical procedure of drawing fluid or air by suction
examples: Her aspiration to become a doctor motivated years of study
The company supports employees' career aspirations
The doctor performed an aspiration to remove fluid
Aspiration of food particles can cause pneumonia

definitions: common medicine used to reduce pain, fever, and inflammation
examples: She took two aspirin for her headache
Doctors often recommend aspirin to prevent heart attacks

definitions: person who physically attacks or assaults another person violently
examples: The victim couldn't identify her assailant in the dark
Police arrested the assailant at the scene

definitions: person who murders an important person for political or religious reasons
examples: The assassin was captured before reaching the target
Historical assassins often worked for political factions

definitions: murder of an important person, especially for political or religious reasons
examples: The assassination shocked the entire nation
Security was increased after the attempted assassination

definitions: testing of metal or ore to determine its ingredients and quality
examples: The assay revealed high gold content in the ore
They sent samples to the lab for a complete assay

definitions: collection or gathering of things or people brought together
examples: The museum displayed an assemblage of ancient tools
An assemblage of protesters gathered in the square

definitions: person who puts together parts in manufacturing or production
computer program that converts assembly language into machine code
examples: The assembler worked on the production line installing car doors
Skilled assemblers can complete hundreds of units per day
The assembler translated the code into executable instructions
Programmers used an assembler to optimize the software

definitions: man who is an elected member of a legislative assembly
examples: The assemblyman proposed new legislation on education funding
Several assemblymen voted against the proposed tax increase

definitions: woman who is an elected member of a legislative assembly
examples: The assemblywoman championed healthcare reform in her district
She became the first assemblywoman from her county

definitions: expression of approval or agreement, especially to a proposal or request
examples: The board gave their assent to the merger proposal
She nodded her assent when asked about the plan
